original: Berglund, Johan Emil, f. d. domprost, Skövde, f. 21/7/73 i Hångsdala, Skarab. 1., av Gustaf B. o. Johanna Larsdotter. G. 10 m. Ellen Maria Myrsten. Barn: Nils f. 12, Gustaf 14. — Mog:ex. i Upps. 96, teol. fil. ex. 97, teor. o. prakt. teol. ex. samt prästv. f. Skara stift 00, teol. lic. 08. Tj- i Larv, Skövde, Vilske-Kleva o. Stenstorp, skolpräst i Katrineholm 03-04, pater v. Fjellstedtska sk. i Upps. 04-08, past:adj. i Tidaholm 09-11, kyr-koh. i Hössna 11-26, kontr:prost i Redvägs kontr. 24-26, uppf. i första försl :rummet t. domprost i Karlstad 21, domprost i Skara 26, kontr :prost i domprosteriet 28. Emeritus 45. Led. av Skara stifts ungd:råd 13, sv. kyrkans miss:styr. stiftsombud 18, ordf. i stiftets miss :råd 20, sv. kyrkans diakonistyr. stiftsombud 23, led. o. v. ordf. i stiftsrådet 26, v. ordf. i ungd:rådet s. å., suppl. i Allm. sv. prästfören. centralstyr. 26-29, ord. led. där 29, suppl. i styr. f. Prästerskapets änke-o. pupillkassa 26-34, fullm. i samma kassa 34, av domkap. vald suppl. i Skara stiftsnd 33, preses v. prästmöt. 28, led. av allm. kyrkomöt. 34, 36 o. 38 m. m. Statens resestip. 10. Skr.: ett stort antal upps. o. art. i kyrkl. m. fl. frågor. KN02kl. 26.
translated:
Berglund, Johan Emil, former dean, Skövde, born on July 21st, 1873 in Hångsdala, Skaraborg county, son of Gustaf B. and Johanna Larsdotter. He married Ellen Maria Myrsten in 19xx and they had two children: Nils, born in 1912, and Gustaf, born in 1914.  Berglund attended Mogi:ex in Uppsala in 1896, teol. fil. ex. in 1897, teor. o. prakt. teol. ex. as well as a priest's ordination from the Skara diocese. He obtained his teol. lic. in 1908. He worked in Larv, Skövde, Vilske-Kleva, Stenstorp, and was a school priest in Katrineholm from 1903-1904, a pastor at Fjellstedt's school in Uppsala from 1904-1908, assistant pastor in Tidaholm from 1909-1911, parish vicar in Hössna from 1911-1926, dean in the Redväg district from 1924-1926, and occupied the first position for the Deanery of Karlstad from 1921. He became the dean in Skara in 1926 and a district dean in 1928. He retired in 1945. 

Berglund was a member of the Skara diocese youth council in 1913, a representative of the Swedish Church's mission control in 1918, chairman of the diocese's mission council in 1920, representative of the Swedish Church's deaconage control in 1923, member and vice chairman of the diocese council in 1926, and a substitute in the Central Committee of the Swedish Clergy Association from 1926-1929, and an ordinary member there from 1929 onwards. He was also a substitute in the board of the Priesthood's Widows and Orphans Fund from 1926-1934, and a full member of the same fund from 1934. He was a substitute chosen by the cathedral chapter in the Skara diocese in 1933, president of the priest's meeting in 1928, and a member of the general church meeting in 1934, 1936 and 1938, among others. He was awarded the Knight of the Order of the North Star in 1926. Berglund had written a large number of papers and articles on church-related topics. He received a travel scholarship from the state in 1910.
